verses.verse: The word <WH1697> of Yahweh <WH3068> came again to me, <WH559> saying,
You, <WH1121> son of man, <WH120> take up <WH5375> a lamentation <WH7015> over Tyre; <WH6865>

and tell <WH559> Tyre, <WH6865> you who dwell <WH3427> at the entry <WH3997> of the sea, <WH3220> who are the merchant <WH7402> of the peoples <WH5971> to many <WH7227> islands, <WH339> thus says <WH559> the Lord <WH136> Yahweh: <WH3069> You, <WH6865> Tyre, have said, <WH559> I am perfect <WH3632> in beauty. <WH3308>
Your borders <WH1366> are in the heart <WH3820> of the seas; <WH3220> your builders <WH1129> have perfected <WH3634> your beauty. <WH3308>
They have made <WH1129> all your planks <WH3871> of fir trees <WH1265> from Senir; <WH8149> they have taken <WH3947> a cedar <WH730> from Lebanon <WH3844> to make <WH6213> a mast for you. <WH8650>

Of the oaks <WH437> of Bashan <WH1316> have they made <WH6213> your oars; <WH4880> they have made <WH6213> your benches <WH7175> of ivory <WH8127> inlaid <WH1323> in boxwood, <WH839> from the islands <WH339> of Kittim. <WH3794>

Of <WH4666> fine linen <WH8336> with embroidered work <WH7553> from Egypt <WH4714> was your sail, <WH5251> that it might be to you for a banner; <WH8504> blue and purple <WH713> from the islands <WH339> of Elishah <WH473> was your awning. <WH4374>
The inhabitants <WH3427> of Sidon <WH6721> and Arvad <WH719> were your rowers: <WH7751> your wise <WH2450> men, <WH6865> Tyre, were in you, <WH2259> they were your pilots.

The old <WH2205> men of Gebal <WH1380> and the wise <WH2450> men of it were in you your repairers <WH919> of ship seams: <WH591> all the ships of the sea <WH3220> with their mariners <WH4419> were in you to deal <WH6148> in your merchandise. <WH4627>

Persia <WH6539> and Lud <WH3865> and Put <WH6316> were in your army, <WH2428> your men <WH582> of war: <WH4421> they hanged <WH8518> the shield <WH4043> and helmet <WH3553> in you; <WH5414> they set forth your comeliness. <WH1926>

The men <WH1121> of Arvad <WH719> with your army <WH2428> were on your walls <WH2346> all around, <WH5439> and valorous <WH1575> men were in your towers; <WH4026> they hanged <WH8518> their shields <WH7982> on your walls <WH2346> all around; <WH5439> they have <WH3634> perfected <WH3634> your beauty. <WH3308>

Tarshish <WH8659> was your merchant <WH5503> by reason of the multitude <WH7230> of all kinds of riches; <WH1952> with silver, <WH3701> iron, <WH1270> tin, <WH913> and lead, <WH5777> they traded <WH5414> for your wares. <WH5801>

Javan, <WH3120> Tubal, <WH8422> and Meshech, <WH4902> they were your traffickers; <WH7402> they traded <WH5414> the persons <WH5315> of men <WH120> and vessels <WH3627> of brass <WH5178> for your merchandise. <WH4627>
They of the house <WH1004> of Togarmah <WH8425> traded <WH5414> for your wares with horses <WH5483> and war horses <WH6571> and mules. <WH6505>

The men <WH1121> of Dedan <WH1719> were your traffickers; <WH7402> many <WH7227> islands <WH339> were the market <WH5506> of your hand: <WH3027> they brought <WH7725> you in exchange <WH814> horns <WH7161> of ivory <WH8127> and ebony. <WH1894>

Syria <WH758> was your merchant <WH5503> by reason of the multitude <WH7230> of your handiworks: <WH4639> they traded <WH5414> for your wares <WH5801> with emeralds, <WH5306> purple, <WH713> and embroidered work, <WH7553> and fine linen, <WH948> and coral, <WH7215> and rubies. <WH3539>

Judah, <WH3063> and the land <WH776> of Israel, <WH3478> they were your traffickers: <WH7402> they traded <WH5414> for your merchandise <WH4627> wheat <WH2406> of Minnith, <WH4511> and confections, <WH6436> and honey, <WH1706> and oil, <WH8081> and balm. <WH6875>

Damascus <WH1834> was your merchant <WH5503> for the multitude <WH7230> of your handiworks, <WH4639> by reason of the multitude <WH7230> of all kinds of riches, <WH1952> with the wine <WH3196> of Helbon, <WH2463> and white <WH6713> wool. <WH6785>

Vedan <WH2051> and Javan <WH3120> traded <WH235> with yarn for <WH5414> your wares: <WH5801> bright <WH6219> iron, <WH1270> cassia, <WH6916> and calamus, <WH7070> were among your merchandise. <WH4627>
Dedan <WH1719> was your trafficker <WH7402> in precious <WH2667> cloths <WH899> for riding. <WH7396>

Arabia, <WH6152> and all the princes <WH5387> of Kedar, <WH6938> they were the merchants <WH5503> of your hand; <WH3027> in lambs, <WH3733> and rams, <WH352> and goats, <WH6260> in these were they your merchants. <WH5503>

The traffickers <WH7402> of Sheba <WH7614> and Raamah, <WH7484> they were your traffickers; <WH7402> they traded <WH5414> for your wares <WH5801> with the chief <WH7218> of all spices, <WH1314> and with all precious <WH3368> stones, <WH68> and gold. <WH2091>
Haran <WH2771> and Canneh <WH3656> and Eden, <WH5729> the traffickers <WH7402> of Sheba, <WH7614> Asshur <WH804> and Chilmad, <WH3638> were your traffickers. <WH7402>

These were your traffickers <WH7402> in choice <WH4360> wares, <WH1545> in wrappings of blue <WH8504> and embroidered work, <WH7553> and in chests <WH1595> of rich clothing, <WH1264> bound <WH2280> with cords <WH2256> and made of cedar, <WH729> among your merchandise. <WH4819>

The ships <WH591> of Tarshish <WH8659> were your caravans <WH7788> for your merchandise: <WH4627> and you were replenished, <WH4390> and made very <WH3966> glorious <WH3513> in the heart <WH3820> of the seas. <WH3220>
Your rowers <WH7751> have brought <WH935> you into great <WH7227> waters: <WH4325> the east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> has broken <WH7665> you in the heart <WH3820> of the seas. <WH3220>

Your riches, <WH1952> and your wares, <WH5801> your merchandise, <WH4627> your mariners, <WH4419> and your pilots, <WH2259> your repairers <WH919> of ship seams, <WH6148> and the dealers in your merchandise, <WH4627> and all your men <WH582> of war, <WH4421> who are in you, <WH6951> with all your company which is in the midst <WH8432> of you, <WH5307> shall fall into the heart <WH3820> of the seas <WH3220> in the day <WH3117> of your ruin. <WH4658>
At the sound <WH6963> of the cry <WH2201> of your pilots <WH2259> the suburbs <WH4054> shall shake. <WH7493>

All who handled <WH8610> the oar, <WH4880> the mariners, <WH4419> and all the pilots <WH2259> of the sea, <WH3220> shall come down <WH3381> from their ships; <WH591> they shall stand <WH5975> on the land, <WH776>

and shall cause their voice <WH6963> to be heard <WH8085> over you, <WH2199> and shall cry bitterly, <WH4751> and shall cast up <WH5927> dust <WH6083> on their heads, <WH7218> they shall wallow <WH6428> themselves in the ashes: <WH665>

and they shall make <WH7144> themselves bald <WH7139> for you, <WH2296> and clothe them with sackcloth, <WH8242> and they shall weep <WH1058> for you in bitterness <WH4751> of soul <WH5315> with bitter <WH4751> mourning. <WH4553>

In their wailing <WH5204> they shall take up <WH5375> a lamentation <WH7015> for you, <WH6969> and lament over you, <WH6865> saying, Who is there like Tyre, like her who is brought to silence <WH1822> in the midst <WH8432> of the sea? <WH3220>

When your wares <WH5801> went forth <WH3318> out <WH3318> of the seas, <WH3220> you filled <WH7646> many <WH7227> peoples; <WH5971> you enriched the kings <WH4428> of the earth <WH776> with the multitude <WH7230> of your riches <WH1952> and of your merchandise. <WH4627>

In the time <WH6256> that you were broken <WH7665> by the seas <WH3220> in the depths <WH4615> of the waters, <WH4325> your merchandise <WH4627> and all your company <WH6951> fell <WH5307> in your midst. <WH8432>
All the inhabitants <WH3427> of the islands <WH339> are astonished <WH8074> at you, <WH4428> and their kings are horribly <WH8178> afraid; <WH8175> they are troubled <WH7481> in their face. <WH6440>
The merchants <WH5503> among the peoples <WH5971> hiss <WH8319> at you; <WH1091> you are become a terror, and you shall nevermore have any being. <WH5704>
